sent_1.text: Sertraline treatment of generalized social phobia : a 20-week , double-blind , placebo-controlled study .

sent_2.text: OBJECTIVE The authors evaluated the efficacy , safety , and tolerability of sertraline , a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor , in the treatment of generalized social phobia .

sent_3.text: METHOD Adult outpatients with generalized social phobia ( N=204 ) from 10 Canadian centers were randomly assigned to receive sertraline or placebo in a 2:1 ratio for a 20-week double-blind

sent_4.text: study following a 1-week , single-blind , placebo run-in .

sent_5.text: The initial dose of sertraline was 50 mg/day with increases of 50 mg/day every 3 weeks permitted after the fourth week of treatment ( dosing was flexible up to a

sent_7.text: Primary efficacy assessments were the percentage of patients rated much or very much improved on the Clinical Global Impression ( CGI ) improvement item and the mean changes from baseline

entity_14.text: percentage of patients rated much or very much improved on the Clinical Global Impression ( CGI ) improvement item

sent_8.text: to study endpoint in total score on the social phobia subscale of the Marks Fear Questionnaire and total score on the Brief Social Phobia Scale .

entity_16.text: endpoint in total score on the social phobia subscale of the Marks Fear Questionnaire

entity_17.text: total score on the Brief Social Phobia Scale

sent_9.text: RESULTS In intent-to-treat endpoint analyses of 203 of the patients , significantly more of the 134 patients given sertraline ( N=71 [ 53 % ] ) than of the 69

sent_10.text: patients receiving placebo ( N=20 [ 29 % ] ) were considered responders according to their CGI improvement scores at the end of treatment .

sent_11.text: The mean reductions in the social phobia subscale of the Marks Fear Questionnaire and in the total score on the Brief Social Phobia Scale were 32.6 % and 34.3 %

entity_20.text: mean reductions in the social phobia subscale of the Marks Fear Questionnaire

entity_21.text: total score on the Brief Social Phobia Scale

sent_12.text: in the sertraline group and 10.8 % and 18.6 % in the placebo group , respectively .

sent_13.text: Analysis of covariance showed superiority of sertraline over placebo on all primary and secondary efficacy measures .

sent_14.text: Sertraline was well tolerated : 103 ( 76 % ) of the 135 sertraline-treated patients and 54 ( 78 % ) of the 69 placebo-treated patients completed the study .

sent_15.text: CONCLUSIONS Sertraline is an effective treatment for patients with generalized social phobia .
